1-2-3-go

Home / 1-2-3-go

Mathematics in Everyday Life

Mathematics ('math' for short) can be a scary topic in school - but in life, math is everywhere. In this Nova module you will learn about some fun ways you can use math - such as using math to create a secret code, or figuring out how much you would weigh on another planet.


Week 1

Introduction

Get Started

Introduction

An introduction to the power of numbers and mathematics by watching or reading about number and discussing it with your Nova Councelor.

Get Started

Week 2

Adventure

Lab Coming Soon

Adventure

You will complete the Wolf, Bear or Webelos adventure for this Nova award.

Get Started

Week 3

Do Math

Lab Coming Soon

Do Math

Use the power of mathematics to figure out something that you can't measure - how much you weigh on another planet.

Get Started

Week 4

Secret Codes

Lab Coming Soon

Secret Codes

Use mathematics to create a secret code and send a message to a friend. Teach them how to decode your message.

Get Started

1-2-3 Go! Lab Plan

This module is designed to help you explore how you use math in every day life. For the full requirements, see 1-2-3 Go! on Scouting.org. The following are the requirements addressed in this NovaStemLabs journey.

Week 1 - Introduction

  • Watch an episode or episodes (about 30-minutes total) of a show that involves math or physics. Then do the following:
    1. Make a list of at least two questions or ideas from what you watched.
    2. Discuss two of the questions or ideas with your counselor.

Week 2 - Adventure

  • Wolf Scouts - Complete the Code fo the Wolf adventure.
  • Bear Scouts - Complete the Robotics adventure.
  • Webelos Scouts - Complete the Game Design adventure.

Week 3 - Do Math

  1. Choose TWO of the following places and calculate how much you would weigh there.
    1. On the sun or the moon
    2. On Jupiter or Pluto
    3. On a planet that you choose
  2. Calculate the volume of air in your bedroom. Make sure your measurements have the same units—all feet or all inches—and show your work.
  3. Watch an episode or episodes (about 30-minutes total) of a show that involves math or physics. Then do the following:
    1. Make a list of at least two questions or ideas from what you watched.
    2. Discuss two of the questions or ideas with your counselor.

Week 4 - Secret Codes

    1. Look up, then discuss with your counselor each of the following:
      1. Cryptography
      2. At least three ways secret codes or ciphers are made
      3. How secret codes and ciphers relate to mathematics
    2. Design a secret code or cipher. Then do the following:
      1. Write a message in your code or cipher.
      2. Share your code or cipher with your counselor.
    3. Discuss with your counselor how math affects your everyday life.

Do you want to start a STEM program in your unit?

Everything you need to get started is here for you, and its free.

Learn How

About Us

Nova STEM Labs is a personal project by Doug Seven to create journeys for Cub Scouts who are interested in STEM and are trying to earn their Nova STEM awards. This site is also designed to enable Cub Scouts leaders to teach STEM topics to Scouts.
